Data Sources: China Health and Retirement Longitudinal Study (CHARLS) dataset
Sample Characteristics: Age ≥45 years, includes chronic diseases (e.g., hypertension, dyslipidemia, diabetes), smoking, drinking, social participation, economic and environmental factors
Racial/Ethnic Composition (Development): Predominantly Chinese (Han and possibly minority groups)

Data Sources: China Health and Retirement Longitudinal Study (CHARLS) 2011 dataset
Sample Characteristics: Rural elderly individuals living alone

Data Sources: OptumLabs Data Warehouse (OLDW)
Sample Characteristics: Patients with persistent asthma who received asthma biologic therapy (benralizumab, dupilumab, mepolizumab, omalizumab, reslizumab)

Data Sources: Isle of Wight Birth Cohort (IOWBC) for development; Manchester Asthma and Allergy Study (MAAS) for validation
Sample Characteristics: General population-based cohort (development); general population and high-risk subgroups with parental allergic disease (validation)

Data Sources: Tianjin Medical University Chronic Disease Cohort, UK Biobank (for genetic data), UCSC Genomic Bioinformatics Database
Sample Characteristics: No CKD at baseline, higher incidence of type 2 diabetes and hyperuricemia in CKD group, teachers and government employees, no family history of inherited diseases, no nephrotoxic drug usage

Data Sources: UCI repository CKD dataset
Sample Characteristics: CKD patients and healthy individuals

Data Sources: COPD Surveillance in China
Sample Characteristics: Subjects aged ≥40 years without airflow limitation, with assessed risk factors (smoking, indoor biomass/coal exposure, workplace dust/chemical exposure, history of emphysema, coronary heart disease, or hypertension)

Data Sources: Natural Population Cohort Study in Northwest China (SQ2017YFSF090013) and its sub-project Study on Cohort Construction and Health Follow-up of Xinjiang Multi-ethnic Natural Population (2017YFC0907203)
Sample Characteristics: Rural population with smoking (14.2%), passive smoking (7.9%), coal/biofuel use (95.5%), low socioeconomic status, and some with tuberculosis history

Data Sources: West China Hospital of Sichuan University (hospital medical records)
Sample Characteristics: MI group: Diagnosed with myocardial infarction; Control group: No myocardial infarction

Data Sources: Cooperative Chinese medicine company
Sample Characteristics: AMI patients; excluded images with severe peeling, scars, or unnatural palm positions

Data Sources: Cancer Screening Program in Urban China (CanSPUC) conducted in Henan Province
Sample Characteristics: Non-smokers (excluding former smokers), aged 40–74, no prior lung cancer

Data Sources: Kaiser Permanente Washington Breast Cancer Surveillance Consortium (BCSC) registry
Sample Characteristics: Women without prior invasive breast cancer or ductal carcinoma in situ, aged 40–73 years, attending routine mammography screening
Racial/Ethnic Composition (Development): White: 80.4%, Asian: 8.8%, Black: 3.9%, More than one race: 2.7%, Other: 2.6%, Unknown: 1.5%; Non-Hispanic: 93.7%, Hispanic: 5.0%, Unknown Hispanic: 1.4%

Median Follow-up Time (Years) and IQR: JH Cases: 6 years; JH Controls: 7.4 years; MDA Cases: 4.2 years; MDA Controls: 4.8 years; IQR: NA
Mean Follow-up Time (Years) and Standard: JH Cases: 6.4 years; JH Controls: 8 years; MDA Cases: 5.1 years; MDA Controls: 5.8 years; SD: NA
Data Sources: Breast Cancer Surveillance Consortium (BCSC), Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER), Johns Hopkins University (JH), University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center (MDA)
Sample Characteristics: Women aged 18–88 years with unilateral invasive breast cancer or DCIS, excluding those with CPM or CBC within 6 months

Data Sources: Study of Colorectal Cancer in Scotland (SOCCS); Lothian Bowel Symptoms Study (LABSS)
Sample Characteristics: Participants with gastrointestinal symptoms (e.g., changes in bowel habits, rectal bleeding, weight loss, anaemia, abdominal pain)

Data Sources: EPIC (European Prospective Investigation into Cancer and Nutrition)
Sample Characteristics: Excluded prevalent cancer, diabetes, myocardial infarction, stroke; included smokers (23.5% current, 27.4% former in development set)

Data Sources: UK Genetic Prostate Cancer Study (UKGPCS), UK Biobank
Sample Characteristics: Development: Probands with histologically confirmed PCa (50% diagnosed by symptoms, 24% by PSA screening, 26% unknown); 30% with PCa in first- or second-degree relatives. Validation: Participants free of cancer at recruitment (except nonmelanoma skin cancers).

Data Sources: Electronic medical records, First Hospital of Jilin University
Sample Characteristics: Male patients undergoing prostate biopsy, tPSA >4 ng/ml, abnormal DRE, or imaging findings

Data Sources: National Cancer Center, Korea; 1000 Genome Project phase 3 East Asian Ancestry (EAS)
Sample Characteristics: GC cases (histologically confirmed), healthy controls; H. pylori infection, lifestyle factors (smoking, alcohol, diet)

Data Sources: Seven study sites in China (Cixian, Linzhou, Wuwei, Changsha, Harbin, Luoshan, Sheyang), with risk assessment in Changsha, Harbin, Luoshan, and Sheyang; linked to cancer registry and death surveillance systems
Sample Characteristics: Aged 40–69 years, no history of cancer, no endoscopic examination in past 3 years, assessed for smoking, alcohol consumption, dietary habits, family history of upper gastrointestinal cancer, and gastric disease history

Data Sources: UK Biobank
Sample Characteristics: Participants with complete data on liver cancer outcome and risk factors, excluding those with baseline cancer diagnosis; includes various conditions such as smoking, alcohol use, diabetes, viral hepatitis, non-viral liver diseases, high cholesterol, cardiovascular disease, and family history of cancer

Data Sources: The Second Hospital & Clinical Medical School, Lanzhou University
Sample Characteristics: Patients with HCC or cirrhosis; excluded if on anticoagulation therapy, had HCC treatments, or had other tumors

Data Sources: Publicly available dataset
Sample Characteristics: Participants with smoking, hypertension, stroke, diabetes, and blood pressure medication use

Data Sources: GEO database (GSE113079, GSE59421)
Sample Characteristics: Patients with coronary artery disease (CAD)

Data Sources: Electronic medical record system of Zhenhai Lianhua Hospital, Ningbo, China
Sample Characteristics: Adults undergoing health checkups with conditions such as diabetes mellitus, hypertension, smoking history, and drinking history

Data Sources: Chinese SLE Treatment and Research Group (CSTAR) registry, Peking Union Medical College Hospital
Sample Characteristics: SLE patients, age >18 years, no active infection/tumor/severe SLE/CVD before SLE, using medications (e.g., statins, corticosteroids), some smokers, postmenopausal females, long disease duration, organ damage

Data Sources: MIMIC-III (Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, USA), Historical Database of Ruijin Hospital (HDRJH, China), Real-world data from Ruijin Hospital ICU (China)
Sample Characteristics: ICU patients; sepsis (infection + SOFA score) or non-sepsis; some received antibiotics or mechanical ventilation

Data Sources: Multiethnic Cohort (MEC), Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) registries, Prostate, Lung, Colorectal, and Ovarian Cancer Screening Trial (PLCO), National Lung Screening Trial (NLST)
Sample Characteristics: Ever-smokers with initial primary lung cancer (IPLC) diagnosis
Racial/Ethnic Composition (Development): White: 25.2%, Japanese American: 21.5%, African American: 27.4%, Latino: 13.0%, Native Hawaiian: 8.4%, Others: 4.5%
Racial/Ethnic Composition (Validation): PLCO: White: 88.4%, Asian: 2.4%, African American: 7.0%, Latino: 1.3%, Others: 1.0%; NLST: White: 90.6%, Asian: 1.6%, African American: 5.0%, Latino: 1.2%, Others: 1.6%

Data Sources: Cerner Health Facts database
Sample Characteristics: Hospitalized adult patients (≥18 years) with proven or suspected infection and two or more SIRS criteria for sepsis cases
Racial/Ethnic Composition (Development): African American: 17.8% (11,084 cases + 20,556 controls), Asian: 1.5% (1,085 cases + 1,627 controls), Caucasian: 72.7% (35,059 cases + 95,657 controls), Others/unknown: 7.8% (5,574 cases + 8,201 controls)

Data Sources: Taiwan’s National Health Insurance Research Database (NHIRD)
Sample Characteristics: Patients with HF diagnoses (experimental group) and non-HF participants (control group), matched for sex and age

Data Sources: Liuzhou Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital (stroke green channel timing control system and electronic medical record system)
Sample Characteristics: Patients with AIS, some with history of hypertension, cerebral infarction, cerebral artery occlusion, or carotid atherosclerosis

Data Sources: National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES)
Sample Characteristics: Participants with and without stroke; no specific disease background, surgeries, treatments, or conditions like pregnancy or smoking explicitly mentioned

Data Sources: N/A
Sample Characteristics: Pregnant women

Data Sources: First Affiliated Hospital of Jinan University and Jiangmen Maternity and Child Health Care Hospital
Sample Characteristics: Pregnant women with singleton pregnancy
Median Age (Development) and IQR: Basic Training: 30.0 years (IQR: 27.0–32.0); Basic Validation: 30.0 years (IQR: 27.0–32.0); Extended Training: 30.0 years (IQR: 27.0–32.0); Extended Validation: 29.0 years (IQR: 27.0–32.0)

Data Sources: Medical records from People’s Hospital of Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region
Sample Characteristics: Elderly patients (≥60 years old), some with AD, others without; health conditions include midlife hypertension, diabetes, herpesvirus infection, stroke, traumatic brain injury, depression; lifestyle factors include smoking, exercise, diet, alcohol consumption

Data Sources: National Institute on Aging—Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease Family Study: Genome-Wide Association Study for Susceptibility Loci (phs000168.v2.p2) from the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) through the Genotypes and Phenotypes database (dbGaP)
Sample Characteristics: Cases: Diagnosed with Definite AD by neuropathological criteria or Probable AD by NINCDS-ADRDA criteria, age at diagnosis ≥ 60 years. Controls: No cognitive deterioration or memory loss, no history of psychiatric or neurological disorders.

Data Sources: AMP PD Knowledge Platform (PPMI and PDBP datasets)
Sample Characteristics: Unmedicated PD cases within 1 year of diagnosis (PPMI), PD cases within 5 years of diagnosis regardless of medication status (PDBP), controls unaffected by neurologic diseases

Data Sources: Parkinson’s Progression Marker Initiative (PPMI) dataset
Sample Characteristics: N/A

Disease Name: Heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF) and heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF)
Data Sources: VA Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW), linked to Centers for Medicaid and Medicare Services (CMS) and National Death Index (NDI) databases
Sample Characteristics: Patients with at least one primary care visit at a VA facility, at least one outpatient lipid result between 2002 and 2007, and a blood pressure measurement within 30 days of lipid testing; excluded individuals with severe comorbidities (cancer, dialysis, major mental health disorder), non-white or non-black race, heart failure before or within 30 days of baseline, or death within 30 days of baseline
Average Age and Standard Deviation (Deve: White men: 63.6 years (SD: 9.7); Black men: 57.3 years (SD: 10.3); White women: 56.5 years (SD: 11.4); Black women: 49.3 years (SD: 7.4)

Data Sources: Community hypertension clinics in 5 communities in Guangzhou and Dongguan, China
Sample Characteristics: Patients with a history of hypertension receiving antihypertensive medicines

Data Sources: Alberta’s Tomorrow Project (ATP) cohort data, linked with Alberta’s administrative health data
Sample Characteristics: Participants aged 35–69 years, without any history of cancer (other than non-melanoma skin cancer), free of hypertension at baseline
Racial/Ethnic Composition (Development): Aboriginal: 0.37%, Asian: 4.51%, White: 92.21%, Latin American Hispanic: 0.89%, Black: 0.53%, Other: 1.49%
